runs.comm: huge seam movement inwards, that pitched a long way outside off and curves in dramatically, leaves it to the keeper who has to dive to his left to collect
again the ball curves in, defended back towards the bowler
Davids skips across the stumps and clips this towards midwicket
back of a length and well outside off, pushed off the front foot through cover
too far outside off stump
length ball closer to off stump, forward defensive towards cover
slants in towards off stump, guided down towards third man for a single, a testing first over from Kulasekara
low full toss on off stump, defended towards midwicket
full ball outside off, de Kock is beaten by that one
full ball hurtling in towards middle stump, defended back towards the bowler
a knee-high full toss just outside off, slapped towards sweeper cover to get three
another full toss, this one is slower and loopy, on middle and leg stump, Davids is far too quick as he tries to play that, has to adjust late and defend down the pitch
another slower one, this one is more of a yorker on off stump, blocked towards mid-on

Kula has struck with another of his massive incutters, unplayable delivery that, that one again swerves in a long way, with the keeper standing up, Davids couldn't skip down to try counter the movement, he stays in the crease, doesn't cover for how much the ball moves and he's bowled
pitched up and wide outside off, left alone by Faf
swings in towards off, clipped towards midwicket for a single
this one is full and on the pads, punched towards mid-on by de Kock
length ball on the pads, looks to clip that towards midwicket but doesn't connect, off the pads towards square leg
looking to turn that towards square leg, a leading edge, the ball doesn't travel anywhere, rolls down the track
from round the wicket, slides away from the right-hander, defended towards point
length ball is worked towards midwicket for a single
de Kock skips down the track and defends that one
this time he steps away towards leg and blocks it, de Kock has decided he needs to use his feet to counter the mystery spin of Senanayake
jumps down the track again, this one skids on, de Kock looks to hammer that over extra cover, gets a thick edge, Jayawardene dives to his left but that is too wide for him at slip and it runs away
again he charges down, happy to defend to the leg side though
short of length ball well outside off, not as much movement in this time, du Plessis reaches out and pushes it behind point
de Kock is using his feet against the quicks as well, skips down the track and caresses the ball well wide of mid-on for four
back of a length ball on the pads, whipped away for four more, de Kock takes a small step forward and sends it to the midwicket boundary
another whip to midwicket, straight to the fielder this time though, Kulasekara proving a lot less dangerous when up against the left-hander
shifts his line to well outside off, a thick inside-edge from de Kock as he again looks to play that through the leg side
length ball just outside leg stump, defended back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, tucked towards midwicket from du Plessis
slides away after short of a length ball, outside off, du Plessis pushes it away to the off side
looks for a booming drive outside off but he is beaten
closer to the stumps this time, defended by du Plessis
finally gets a single and gets off the strike
length ball, de Kock skips down and works the ball towards mid-on
short of length ball on the pads, clipped towards square leg
short from Mathews, but only at 118.5kph, de Kock plants his front foot down the track and pulls that towards midwicket, he's not holding back
slanting across de Kock who throws his bat at it and sends it down towards third man
back of a length ball on middle stump, 120kph, defended to the off side
back of a length and very close to off stump, defended behind point by du Plessis

du Plessis releases any pressure he was under by effortlessly launching the final delivery of the over beyond the long-on boundary, didn't seem to put any power behind that stroke at all, still sent it a long way, he was 4 off 12 before this stroke
stays in the crease this time, moves across and defends
pushed to the right of the bowler, who dives and fields it
slides that down the leg side, there was some sound as the ball passed the bat as de Kock went for the sweep, the umpire calls it wides as both the batsman and keeper miss it

de Kock's strategy of stepping down to nearly every delivery worked well so far, but he has missed this one and is stranded a long way out, Sangakkara has loads of time to take off the bails, Senanayake ends an enterprising innings, that ball moved in towards the pads instead of spinning away
Duminy blocks it back towards the bowler
down the leg side and that is helped along towards fine leg
swinging in towards the pads, elegantly dispatched towards deep square leg

Malinga at his best, as always when playing Malinga the batsman has to be worried about his toes, du Plessis can't get the bat down in time to stop that inswinging delivery that takes out middle stump, a full delivery deflected off the pads and heads for the stumps, too good for du Plessis
and another in the blockhole, testing delivery first up for de Villiers, who manages to defend that one
superb shot from Duminy, length ball well outside off, crashed through extra cover, confidently struck by Duminy
135.9kph yorker, swinging a touch away, pushed towards extra cover by Duminy
short of a length ball on off stump, eased away towards sweeper cover
length ball that spins away little, AB de Villiers gets the timing perfect as he square-drives that one, is there a better player of that shot in world cricket?
skips down and looks to power the ball down the ground, hit towards mid-on for a single
length ball outside off, not too much turn there, defended in front of point for a single
short of length ball on off stump, crisply pushed towards cover
slides that on towards the pads, whipped towards square leg for one more
length ball on off stump, not much turn for Mendis in this over, eased towards mid-on
slower one from Mathews, 99.6kph, on a length and heading for off stump, defended to the leg side
another slower one, 99.7kph, full and on the pads, clipped towards deep square leg
slanting in towards the pads, AB dances down and whips it to the leg side, can't get it past midwicket
length ball outside off, driven towards midwicket
back of length ball outside off, gracefully punched towards sweeper cover
length ball on the pads, worked towards square leg by Duminy
Mendis sends this on a length, pitching around off, Duminy isn't known to be the best player of spin, but he strides out and confidently launches this over the bowler's head for four
stays on the back foot and pokes this behind point for two more
stays on the back foot, there's a bit of width for him there, slashed away behind point for a boundary, Duminy reading Mendis well here

just as I type that, Duminy doesn't read this one from Mendis, he's looking to work the ball to the leg side, expects the ball to turn towards his pads, it doesn't and there's an outside edge down to third man
length ball on the pads, eased towards long-on for one more, completes an expensive over for Mendis
Angelo nearly sends this down the leg side, helped along behind square leg

short of length and well outside off, flat-batted back past the bowler and towards mid-off, Malinga misses it as he looks to field it the first time, then misses it a second time as he runs back towards the ball
drops that one in the direction of backward point, played with soft hands to get a single
skips down and lashes that towards deep midwicket, quick running gets them a second
short ball, at Mathews' pace - 127kph - that is an easy put away, and AB puts it away, skips out and pulls it ferociously for four

AB charges out and looks to hammer another shortish ball, this was well outside off, AB can only send it as far as short extra cover, the fielder there had little more than one stump to aim at and he hit it, catching AB just short, that is a game-changing throw, AB was just looking like he had gauged the pitch and was trying to open out, once again a good bit of fielding from Kusal Perera gets rid of AB
length ball on off stump, defended off the front foot, sends it in front of point
nearly dragged that back onto the stumps, it was down the leg side, Duminy went for the sweep, doesn't connect, off the arm and nearly onto the stumps
defends this back towards the bowler
skips down and works this towards midwicket
outside off, plays it late towards point
much too short from Mendis, sits up for Duminy, who waits on the backfoot before muscling it to the square-leg boundary
on the pads, helped along towards backward square leg
on the pads once more, worked towards square leg for one more
Miller has repeatedly shown how good he is at hitting straight, he jumps down the track and connects perfectly with a length ball, sends that well over long-on for six
pegged back by that one, defended to the off side
short of length ball on off stump, eased towards long-on for a single
tucked to midwicket for a quick single
onto the pads, a length ball, whipped behind square leg by Miller
flighted ball, on a length and pitching on middle, waits on the back foot and punches it towards mid-on

Duminy looks to smash that over the leg side, but can only top-edge as he attempts a big hit, the ball swirls around but Mathews settles under it around extra cover and pouches it, that one drifted in from Senanayake and spins away
slides on outside off, worked from the backfoot towards point
full ball from over the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
the legbreak from Senanayake, Wiese is beaten by that one outside off
on the pads, whipped towards deep midwicket, batsmen sprint back for the second
Miller steps down the track and looks to launch that over the leg side, the outside edge sends the ball swirling towards deep extra cover, wide of the fielder, Miller survives
defends this off the back foot, towards point
the offspinner from Mendis, perfectly struck by Miller, sends it 98m as it easily clears the long-off boundary, when Miller connects well, there's no doubt over whether the ball will clear the rope
length ball just outside off, calmly works this towards wide long-on for a quick two
searches for the big hit, a thick inside edge, the ball rolls behind square leg for one more

full and well outside off, doesn't look to power that one full toss, eases it in front of point, Kulasekara has to runs across to stop that, he can't though he gets a hand on it, an ordinary effort in the field and that is a boundary
full and way outside off, Miller reaches across and taps it behind point
badly mistimed as Wiese backs away from the stumps and looks to power the ball through the off side, the ball bounces once before reaching long-off
full and well outside off, chopped towards sweeper cover for a single
exposing all three stumps as he moves well behind legstump, slaps that length ball towards cover
full ball outside off, dug out towards point

a great sight for the bowler that, has the batsman on all fours with a yorker that tails in, Miller looks to get his feet out of the way, he just about manages to, but he can't keep his balance, somehow defends it to the leg side
looks to thrash this one through the off side, it was a high full toss just outside off, a miscue from Wiese and a simple overhead chance put down by Chandimal at extra cover
sent towards sweeper cover for a single

Chandimal makes amends for that drop with a superb catch to send back David Miller, he has to run back from cover after Miller miscues an attempted big hit, with these swirling winds around it is not easy to judge where the ball is going to land, Chandimal judges it perfectly and holds on
length ball is well hit by Wiese, but can't beat long-off
full ball on the stumps, hit straight to Chandimal, who is being followed by the ball it seems, a direct hit could have caused some trouble for Parnell, Chandimal misses
much too wide outside off
full ball just outside off, squeezed out towards mid-off
goes for the yorker, misses and it is a full toss just outside off, Wiese can't time it again as he lashes that down the ground for a single
full and just outside off, Parnell looks for an ambitious shot, looking to lap that from outside off, tough to do it against Malinga, Parnell misses
full ball on offstump, Parnell puts away the lap shot and looks for a more old-fashioned thump down the ground, connects well, sends the ball towards long-off, a misfield there allows an extra run
low full toss on off stump, Parnell dances down and powers that between the bowler and long-off, to well struck for Thisara at long-off
Malinga finishes off with a bouncer, Parnell dabs that down towards third man to end the innings with a couple, a good bit of fielding from Kulasekara in the deep
